00:00:00:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:00:210000.Dialogue: All right, that's the last servo. Behold the Mobile Omnidirectional Neutralization and Termination Eradicator. Or...

00:00:13:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:13:150000.Dialogue: Featuring one articulated razor-sharp killing saw, one polycarbonate grinding and flipping wheel, steel-armor plate exoskeleton top and bottom, and enough horsepower to drive a 110 pounds of mechanized death from zero to holy crap in 4.8 seconds.

00:00:27:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:27:180000.Dialogue: Is it wrong to say I love our killer robot?

00:00:31:130000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:31:130000.Dialogue: As with my father, I both love and fear it.

00:00:35:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:35:170000.Dialogue: All right, enough chitchat. Let's destroy something.

00:00:41:090000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:41:090000.Dialogue: What shall be first to taste the wrath of MONTE?

00:00:46:190000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:46:190000.Dialogue: Perhaps today is the day we finally find out what's inside the Magic Eight Ball.

00:00:52:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:52:150000.Dialogue: Did it when I was four. It's an icosahedral die floating in tinted blue water.

00:00:57:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:57:200000.Dialogue: Man, call spoiler alert before you say things like that.

00:01:03:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:03:230000.Dialogue: What did the toaster oven ever do to you?

00:01:06:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:06:010000.Dialogue: What did I ever do to Jimmy Mullins in the third grade? He still punched me in the face with my own fists.

00:01:12:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:12:080000.Dialogue: Sorry, little nerd, you were just in the wrong boys' room at the wrong time.

00:01:19:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:19:170000.Dialogue: This is an auspicious moment. Like Robert Oppenheimer or Neil Armstrong, we need the appropriate words to mark this historic scientific event.

00:02:01:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:01:010000.Dialogue: No, I think I'm just going to stay in tonight and do laundry.

00:02:31:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:31:020000.Dialogue: This door got the full MONTE.

00:02:39:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:39:130000.Dialogue: Yeah, well, it almost killed me.

00:02:41:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:41:230000.Dialogue: If it wanted to kill you, you'd be dead.

00:02:48:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:48:180000.Dialogue: So, who exactly does it want to kill?

00:02:51:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:51:110000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, are you unaware of the upcoming Southern California Robot Fighting League Round Robin Invitational?

00:02:59:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:59:180000.Dialogue: You know, since I moved last year, not all my mail has been forwarded.

00:03:05:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:05:180000.Dialogue: It's a big deal. There's an awards banquet and a dance afterward. Perhaps you'd like to come with me.

00:03:15:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:15:050000.Dialogue: I know the other fellas would be really excited to see a girl there.

00:03:19:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:19:210000.Dialogue: How is it supposed to be a dance if I'm the only girl?

00:03:22:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:22:040000.Dialogue: Well, that may be a slight exaggeration. You'd be the only doable girl.

00:03:32:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:32:150000.Dialogue: How is doable anything but a compliment?

00:03:35:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:35:150000.Dialogue: - Why don't we just work on the robot?

00:03:44:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:44:210000.Dialogue: The carnal repartee, the erotic to and fro. But as delicious as the appetizer might be, at some point we will have to succumb and eat the entrée while it's still...

00:04:10:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:10:220000.Dialogue: Look, normally I can just ignore you. I get it... you're a little peculiar. Like Sheldon.

00:04:16:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:16:080000.Dialogue: Excuse me, Penny, but in this room, you're the one who's peculiar.

00:04:24:080000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:24:080000.Dialogue: But back to you. I know you think you're some sort of smooth-talking ladies' man, but the truth is, you are just pathetic and creepy.

00:04:36:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:36:230000.Dialogue: I am saying it is not a compliment to call me doable. It's not sexy to stare at my ass and say, It must be jelly 'cause jam don't shake like that.

00:04:46:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:46:150000.Dialogue: And most important, we are not dancing a tango, we're not to'ing and fro'ing. Nothing is ever going to happen between us. Ever.

00:04:54:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:54:180000.Dialogue: Wait a minute. This isn't flirting. You're serious.

00:04:59:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:59:040000.Dialogue: Flirting? You think I'm flirting with you? I am not flirting with you. No woman is ever gonna flirt with you. You're just gonna grow old and die alone.

00:05:16:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:16:030000.Dialogue: I'm going home to live my creepy, pathetic life.

00:05:32:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:32:050000.Dialogue: He said maybe we should enter you in the killer robot competition.

00:05:56:010000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:56:010000.Dialogue: Here's a crazy idea, Ma: Answer it!

00:06:02:210000.Speaker: Howard’s Mother
00:06:02:210000.Dialogue: All right, hold on. It's your friend, Leonard! He wants to know why you're not at school today!

00:06:11:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:11:090000.Dialogue: I don't go to school, Ma. I work at a university.

00:06:15:230000.Speaker: Howard’s Mother
00:06:15:230000.Dialogue: That's a school! Now pick up the phone!

00:06:19:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:19:070000.Dialogue: I don't want to talk to anybody.

00:06:21:070000.Speaker: Howard’s Mother
00:06:21:070000.Dialogue: Should I ask Leonard to bring over your homework?!

00:06:25:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:25:170000.Dialogue: I don't have homework. I'm a grown man with a master's degree in engineering!

00:06:34:200000.Speaker: Howard’s Mother
00:06:34:200000.Dialogue: Want me to get you a Popsicle?

00:06:40:140000.Speaker: Howard’s Mother
00:06:40:140000.Dialogue: I ate the cherry. All that's left is green.

00:06:44:110000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:44:110000.Dialogue: You make me want to kill myself.

00:06:48:040000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Other end of the phone call.
00:06:48:040000.Speaker: Raj

00:06:54:090000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Other end of the phone call.
00:06:54:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:54:090000.Dialogue: - Sounds like Penny really got to him.

00:07:03:100000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Other end of the phone call.
00:07:03:100000.Speaker: Raj
00:07:03:100000.Dialogue: Mostly about men from Nantucket and hermits named Dave,

00:07:07:070000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Other end of the phone call.
00:07:07:070000.Speaker: Raj
00:07:07:070000.Dialogue: but he does it with real sensitivity.

00:07:10:010000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Other end of the phone call.
00:07:10:010000.Speaker: Kripke
00:07:10:010000.Dialogue: Hey, Hofstadter. Word around the pwasma wab is you built a wobot?

00:07:15:080000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Other end of the phone call.
00:07:15:080000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:07:18:090000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Other end of the phone call.
00:07:18:090000.Speaker: Kripke
00:07:18:090000.Dialogue: Well, if you have any dewusions about entering him against my wobot, the Kwipke Kwippler in the Southern California Robot Fighting League Wound Wobin Invitational, aka the S.C.R.F.L.R.R.I., his name is gonna be Scwap Metal.

00:07:31:130000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Other end of the phone call.
00:07:31:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:31:130000.Dialogue: Come on, is that really necessary?

00:07:33:180000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Other end of the phone call.
00:07:33:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:33:180000.Dialogue: Leonard, I believe it is. This is trash talk,

00:07:37:060000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Other end of the phone call.
00:07:37:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:37:060000.Dialogue: and trash talk is a traditional component in all sporting events. Kripke, your robot is inferior and it will be defeated by ours because ours exceeds yours in both design and execution.

00:07:52:110000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Other end of the phone call.
00:07:52:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:52:110000.Dialogue: Also, I'm given to understand that your mother is overweight.

00:07:58:180000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Other end of the phone call.
00:07:58:180000.Speaker: Raj

00:08:01:040000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Other end of the phone call.
00:08:01:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:01:040000.Dialogue: Of course, if that is the result of a glandular condition and not sloth and gluttony, I withdraw that comment.

00:08:06:220000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Other end of the phone call.
00:08:06:220000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:06:220000.Dialogue: What difference does it make? Fat is fat.

00:08:09:020000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Other end of the phone call.
00:08:09:020000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:08:11:030000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Other end of the phone call.
00:08:11:030000.Speaker: Kripke
00:08:11:030000.Dialogue: Tell you what, forget the S.C.R.F.L.R.R.I. Wet's settle this woboto a woboto.

00:08:19:050000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Other end of the phone call.
00:08:19:050000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:08:20:120000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Other end of the phone call.
00:08:20:120000.Speaker: Kripke
00:08:20:120000.Dialogue: There's no guarantee we're gonna go against each other in the Wound Wobin, so let's throw down. You know, unless you're afwaid.

00:08:28:230000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Other end of the phone call.
00:08:28:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:28:230000.Dialogue: We accept your challenge. Name a time and place.

00:08:31:190000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Other end of the phone call.
00:08:31:190000.Speaker: Kripke

00:08:34:100000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Other end of the phone call.
00:08:34:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:34:100000.Dialogue: No, don't make it so. Barry, we can't fight you tomorrow. Our engineer is incapacitated.

00:08:39:150000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Other end of the phone call.
00:08:39:150000.Speaker: Kripke

00:08:40:220000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Other end of the phone call.
00:08:40:220000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:40:220000.Dialogue: He's depressed because he's pathetic and creepy and can't get girls.

00:08:45:170000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Other end of the phone call.
00:08:45:170000.Speaker: Kripke
00:08:45:170000.Dialogue: We're all pathetic and cweepy and can't get girls.

00:08:50:110000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Other end of the phone call.
00:08:50:110000.Speaker: Kripke

00:08:55:010000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Other end of the phone call.
00:08:55:010000.Speaker: Kripke
00:08:55:010000.Dialogue: If you're not there, you'll be exposed to widicule.

00:09:00:020000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Other end of the phone call.
00:09:00:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:00:020000.Dialogue: I'm curious, what part of America is that accent from?

00:09:13:050000.Speaker: Leoanrd
00:09:13:050000.Dialogue: - I need you to apologize to How...

00:09:16:210000.Speaker: Leoanrd
00:09:16:210000.Dialogue: Come on. He won't come out of his house and we need him for a robot battle.

00:09:20:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:20:180000.Dialogue: Well, then have the robot go and get him.

00:09:23:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:23:040000.Dialogue: The robot didn't hurt his feelings.

00:09:25:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:25:010000.Dialogue: His feelings needed to be hurt.

00:09:27:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:27:030000.Dialogue: He's been in bed for two days.

00:09:32:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:32:120000.Dialogue: He's not with a... Does it really matter who or what he's with? The guy is devastated.

00:09:39:020000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:39:020000.Dialogue: Please, how could I possibly devastate Howard?

00:09:42:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:42:070000.Dialogue: Okay, don't take this as a criticism, but you kind of have that overexposed-to-gamma-rays thing going on.

00:09:50:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:50:100000.Dialogue: You know, like, most of the time, you're the easygoing Bruce Banner, but then, when you get angry, you kind of turn into, like, you know?

00:10:03:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:03:080000.Dialogue: Seriously? Gamma rays? Bruce Banner? You didn't get The Incredible Hulk? Never mind. Just, please go talk to him.

00:10:10:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:10:220000.Dialogue: And say what? That I didn't mean it, because I meant it.

00:10:14:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:14:100000.Dialogue: Maybe you can go at it from a different angle,

00:10:16:220000.Speaker: Leoanrd
00:10:16:220000.Dialogue: like, you see a glimmer of goodness in him

00:10:19:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:19:230000.Dialogue: and you only said what you said because you want to nurture it and make it shine.

00:10:30:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:30:040000.Dialogue: Okay, let's try it this way.

00:10:32:080000.Speaker: Leoanrd
00:10:32:080000.Dialogue: Remember the day we met and you asked me

00:10:34:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:34:070000.Dialogue: to go to your boyfriend's apartment to get your TV back and he was nine feet tall and he took my pants off and you said... What was that? What did you say? Oh, yes. You said you owed me one.

00:10:48:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:48:040000.Dialogue: Okay, come on, that's not fair.

00:10:49:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:49:230000.Dialogue: I came home with no pants.

00:10:54:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:54:130000.Dialogue: Fine, I'll go over there tomorrow.

00:10:57:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:57:100000.Dialogue: Thank you. I should probably give you a heads up about his mother.

00:11:05:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:05:040000.Dialogue: She's a delightful woman. You'll love her.

00:11:11:070000.Speaker: Howard’s Mother
00:11:11:070000.Dialogue: Howard, there's a blonde girl, Patsy, here to see you!

00:11:17:120000.Speaker: Howard’s Mother
00:11:17:120000.Dialogue: Okay, now she's saying it's Penny.

00:11:21:140000.Speaker: Howard
00:11:21:140000.Dialogue: I don't wanna talk to her. Ma!

00:11:25:100000.Speaker: Howard’s Mother
00:11:25:100000.Dialogue: She ran past me. Was I supposed to tackle her?

00:11:31:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:31:150000.Dialogue: So, I just came by to see how you were doing.

00:11:41:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:11:41:130000.Dialogue: People move away from her on the bus.

00:11:51:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:51:150000.Dialogue: I just want to apologize. For some things that I have said.

00:12:06:080000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:06:080000.Dialogue: I've been informed that you have feelings.

00:12:11:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:11:220000.Dialogue: And apparently, I have hurt them. So, I'm sorry.

00:12:28:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:28:230000.Dialogue: Hey, I'm a big boy. I'm not traumatized by some random comment from some random woman. I mean, get over yourself.

00:13:00:010000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching footage on a laptop screen.
00:13:00:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:00:010000.Dialogue: Oh, my God. That's Kripke's robot?

00:13:03:150000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching footage on a laptop screen.
00:13:03:150000.Speaker: Kripke
00:13:03:150000.Dialogue: As you can see, the Kwippler is weducing the Chevy Cavawier to wubble.

00:13:09:140000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching footage on a laptop screen.
00:13:09:140000.Speaker: Raj

00:13:11:050000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching footage on a laptop screen.
00:13:11:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:11:050000.Dialogue: Sheldon, we have to call it off.

00:13:12:180000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching footage on a laptop screen.
00:13:12:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:12:180000.Dialogue: We don't have that option. We've accepted the challenge. We can't run away from a fight.

00:13:17:110000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching footage on a laptop screen.
00:13:17:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:17:110000.Dialogue: Please, we've spent our whole lives running away from fights.

00:13:21:110000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching footage on a laptop screen.
00:13:21:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:21:110000.Dialogue: Personally, I can squeeze through a hole in a fence half my size.

00:13:25:100000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching footage on a laptop screen.
00:13:25:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:25:100000.Dialogue: Impressive as that may be, MONTE is not us. MONTE has no fear.

00:13:31:040000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching footage on a laptop screen.
00:13:31:040000.Speaker: Raj
00:13:31:040000.Dialogue: Didn't we watch the same video? Kripke's robot just had angry sex with a mid-sized automobile.

00:13:38:110000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching footage on a laptop screen.
00:13:38:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:38:110000.Dialogue: You are overlooking the fact we know what we're up against and we can modify MONTE so that he's prepared.

00:13:43:060000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching footage on a laptop screen.
00:13:43:060000.Speaker: Leoanrd

00:13:44:150000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching footage on a laptop screen.
00:13:44:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:44:150000.Dialogue: Install a bladder and a pair of shorts so he can wet himself.

00:13:48:230000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching footage on a laptop screen.
00:13:48:230000.Speaker: Raj
00:13:48:230000.Dialogue: Excuse me, but how are we gonna make any modifications without Wolowitz? - Have you heard from Penny?

00:13:52:090000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching footage on a laptop screen.
00:13:52:090000.Speaker: Leoanrd

00:13:54:040000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching footage on a laptop screen.
00:13:54:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:54:040000.Dialogue: Have faith, gentlemen. We don't need Wolowitz. Engineering is merely the slow younger brother of physics.

00:14:01:070000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching footage on a laptop screen.
00:14:01:070000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:14:07:070000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are watching footage on a laptop screen.
00:14:07:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:07:070000.Dialogue: Do either of you know how to open the toolbox?

00:14:16:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:14:16:050000.Dialogue: I met Marcy Grossman. She was so beautiful. She just got her braces off but they left a little of the overbite. It was so hot.

00:14:38:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:14:38:060000.Dialogue: I didn't have the courage to ask her out, but I dedicated a song to her at the ninth grade talent show.

00:14:52:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:14:52:030000.Dialogue: On a cloudy day When it's cold outside Marcy Grossman is the month of May

00:15:03:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:03:130000.Dialogue: I guess You'd say What can make me feel this way Marcy Grossman, Marcy Grossman, Marcy Grossman Talkin' 'bout Marcy

00:15:23:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:23:220000.Dialogue: And then she came up with that sexy little chipmunk mouth and spit in my hair.

00:15:34:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:34:170000.Dialogue: Which brings us to tenth grade.

00:15:39:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:39:030000.Dialogue: Do you think maybe sometimes you try too hard?

00:15:45:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:45:030000.Dialogue: Look at me. What chance do I have if I don't try too hard?

00:15:51:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:51:230000.Dialogue: You'd have a terrific chance. I mean, you're smart, you're funny. You have a cool job. You build stuff that goes into outer space.

00:16:01:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:01:030000.Dialogue: I'm telling you, I've known you for a year and a half and this is the first time I feel like I'm talking to a real person. And you know what? I like him. He's a nice guy.

00:16:13:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:13:050000.Dialogue: You really think so? I don't know.

00:16:37:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:37:060000.Dialogue: Nice little bot you've got here.

00:16:43:000000.Speaker: Kripke
00:16:43:000000.Dialogue: Yep. At 3400 RPM. It can cut through steel like it was wubber.

00:16:54:190000.Speaker: Leoanrd
00:16:54:190000.Dialogue: Sheldon, we've gotta call this off.

00:16:56:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:56:230000.Dialogue: No, Leonard. For years, merciless thugs like Kripke have made my life a series of painful noogies and humiliating wedgies and the insensitively named Indian burns.

00:17:10:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:17:10:020000.Dialogue: But we don't have a chance. The only improvement you were able to make was to put fresh batteries in the remote.

00:17:16:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:16:110000.Dialogue: What you fail to realize is Kripke suffers from a fatal flaw: overconfidence from his robot's massive size and its overwhelming power.

00:17:27:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:27:160000.Dialogue: Trust me, Kripke will fall easy prey to my psychological warfare. Observe.

00:17:36:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:36:110000.Dialogue: I would ask if your robot is prepared to meet its maker, but as you are its maker, clearly the two of you have met.

00:17:50:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:17:50:200000.Dialogue: Way to bust out the Jedi mind tricks, dude.

00:17:55:040000.Speaker: Leoanrd
00:17:55:040000.Dialogue: I just wanna make sure we're all clear.

00:17:57:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:57:010000.Dialogue: Standard robotic fighting league rules apply.

00:18:00:010000.Speaker: Kripke
00:18:00:010000.Dialogue: Are you cwazy? This is a stweet fight. The stweet has no rules.

00:18:04:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:04:200000.Dialogue: He's right, Leonard. The paradigm is to the death.

00:18:07:150000.Speaker: Kripke
00:18:07:150000.Dialogue: I will, however, give you the opportunity to concede my superiority now and offer me your robot as the spoils of war.

00:18:15:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:15:110000.Dialogue: Never. I'd rather see MONTE dead than in your hands.

00:18:32:190000.Speaker: Raj
00:18:32:190000.Dialogue: - Come on, Sheldon, you got this.

00:18:56:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:56:110000.Dialogue: Don't hurt us, don't hurt us, don't hurt us!

00:19:04:230000.Scene: The apartment. Monte is in pieces on the table.
00:19:04:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:04:230000.Dialogue: Well, so much for making up

00:19:07:000000.Scene: The apartment. Monte is in pieces on the table.
00:19:07:000000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:07:000000.Dialogue: for the emotional wounds of childhood.

00:19:11:040000.Scene: The apartment. Monte is in pieces on the table.
00:19:11:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:11:040000.Dialogue: I did this. MONTE was killed by my hubris and my pride. No matter what anybody says, this is my fault.

00:19:18:130000.Scene: The apartment. Monte is in pieces on the table.
00:19:18:130000.Speaker: Raj
00:19:18:130000.Dialogue: No one's arguing with you, dude.

00:19:21:130000.Scene: The apartment. Monte is in pieces on the table.
00:19:21:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:19:21:130000.Dialogue: I got your text. How bad is...

00:19:26:020000.Scene: The apartment. Monte is in pieces on the table.
00:19:26:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:26:020000.Dialogue: Forget the robot. What happened to you?

00:19:29:130000.Scene: The apartment. Monte is in pieces on the table.
00:19:29:130000.Speaker: Penny

00:19:38:140000.Scene: The apartment. Monte is in pieces on the table.
00:19:38:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:19:38:140000.Dialogue: Now he knows what bathtubs are capable of doing when you don't treat them with respect.

00:19:44:220000.Scene: The apartment. Monte is in pieces on the table.
00:19:44:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:19:44:220000.Dialogue: They sucker punch you when your eyes are closed.

00:19:49:150000.Scene: The apartment. Monte is in pieces on the table.
00:19:49:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:49:150000.Dialogue: So what do you think, Howard? It's not that bad, right?

00:19:55:020000.Scene: The apartment. Monte is in pieces on the table.
00:19:55:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:19:55:020000.Dialogue: A little electrical tape, some solder... Are you insane?

00:19:59:010000.Scene: The apartment. Monte is in pieces on the table.
00:19:59:010000.Speaker: Howard
00:19:59:010000.Dialogue: I've seen space probes that crashed into the desert that were in better shape than this.

00:20:04:230000.Scene: The apartment. Monte is in pieces on the table.
00:20:04:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:04:230000.Dialogue: You're right. MONTE's gone. We'll bury him in the morning. A simple ceremony. I'll speak. Leonard, you'll play your cello.

00:20:15:040000.Scene: The apartment. Monte is in pieces on the table.
00:20:15:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:20:15:040000.Dialogue: Honey, aren't you getting a little carried away? I mean, it's just a toy robot.

00:20:21:160000.Scene: The apartment. Monte is in pieces on the table.
00:20:21:160000.Speaker: Penny

00:20:30:230000.Scene: The apartment. Monte is in pieces on the table.
00:20:30:230000.Speaker: Penny

00:20:33:070000.Scene: The apartment. Monte is in pieces on the table.
00:20:33:070000.Speaker: Penny

00:20:38:170000.Scene: The apartment. Monte is in pieces on the table.
00:20:38:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:20:38:170000.Dialogue: Don't get the wrong idea. The way I see it, I'm halfway to pity sex.
